LocaleResource.Name: Admin.Configuration.AppSettings.Description
LocaleResource.Value: Configuration in ASP.NET Core is performed using a different configuration providers (e.g. external appsettings.json configuration file, environment variables, etc). These settings are used when the application is launched, so after editing them, the application will be restarted. You can find a detailed description of all configuration parameters in our documentation. Please note that changing the values here will overwrite the external appsettings.json file, settings from other configuration providers will not be affected.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.ConfigureManual.FixedRate.Text
LocaleResource.Value: The fixed shipping rate option allows you to set shipping cost depending on the shipping method.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.ConfigureManual.Manage.Text
LocaleResource.Value: Using this button, you can add new shipping methods or delete the existing ones.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.ConfigureManual.Methods.Text
LocaleResource.Value: This table contains shipping methods used by offline shipping providers. A few shipping methods are created automatically during the installation process.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.ConfigureManual.Switch.Text
LocaleResource.Value: The “Fixed rate/By weight” switch allows you to choose the type of shipping rates you’d like to use in your node.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.CreateEmailAccounts.Description
LocaleResource.Value: It allows you to send notifications to your users

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.EditServicesInfo.Description
LocaleResource.Value: Add info pages describing shipping, return policy and more

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.EmailAccount.DefaultCredentials.Text
LocaleResource.Value: Check to use default credentials for the connection.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.EmailAccount.DisplayName.Text
LocaleResource.Value: Enter the displayed name for outgoing emails of your node. For example, “Dragon Corp. Games S.L. support department”.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.EmailAccount.EmailAddress.Text
LocaleResource.Value: Enter the “from” email address for all outgoing emails of your node. Example: info@dragoncorp.org.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.EmailAccount.Host.Text
LocaleResource.Value: This is the host name or IP address of your mail server. You can normally find this out from your ISP or web host.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.EmailAccount.Password.Text
LocaleResource.Value: This is the password you use to authenticate to your mail server.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.EmailAccount.Port.Text
LocaleResource.Value: Enter the SMTP port of your email server. This is usually port 25.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.EmailAccount.TestEmail.Text
LocaleResource.Value: Enter your email address and send a test email to make sure you set the email account right.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.EmailAccount.Username.Text
LocaleResource.Value: Enter the user name which is used to authenticate to your email server.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.EmailAccount.UseSsl.Text
LocaleResource.Value: Check to use Secure Sockets Layer (SSL) to encrypt the SMTP connection.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.EmailAccountList.DefaultEmailAccount.Text
LocaleResource.Value: Don’t forget to mark one of the existing email accounts as the default one.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.EmailAccountList.Edit.Text
LocaleResource.Value: To edit an email account click the Edit button.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.EmailAccountList.EmailAccounts1.Text
LocaleResource.Value: You can see all the existing email accounts on this page. Only one email account is created automatically during the installation process. You can also create a general contact email, a user support email, and more to contact your users.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.EmailAccountList.EmailAccounts2.Text
LocaleResource.Value: Then, these email accounts will be used to send order notifications, registration emails, and newsletters to your users. But you may as well use only one email account for all these purposes.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.PersonalizeNode.BasicAdvanced.Text
LocaleResource.Value: This two-position Basic/Advanced switch allows you to switch between the page display modes. For convenience of use, the most frequent settings are shown in the Basic mode. If you cannot find a required setting on a page, switch to the Advanced mode to see all the available settings.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.PersonalizeNode.Description
LocaleResource.Value: Add a beautiful logo for your node

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.PersonalizeNode.Intro.Text
LocaleResource.Value: Let us help you to configure your node! We will share a few tips, describing the most important fields for the initial configuration.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.PersonalizeNode.Logo.Text
LocaleResource.Value: In this field, click the Upload a file button, then choose your logo file.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.PoweredBy.Description
LocaleResource.Value: Remove the “Powered by dragonCorp” link from the footer

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.SetUpTaxes.Description
LocaleResource.Value: Configure rates manually or choose a tax service to automate all tax things

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.Node.Name.Text
LocaleResource.Value: Enter your node name in this field. It will be displayed, for instance, in the newsletter and notification emails sent to your users.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.Node.Ssl.Text
LocaleResource.Value: If you already have an SSL certificate installed on the server, enable SSL to protect your users’ data. Do not enable it if you don’t have an SSL certificate installed yet! SSL Certificates provide user trust and improve site rankings. Note that some online payment methods require an SSL certificate installed for correct working. Read how to install and configure SSL certificates here.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.Node.Url.Text
LocaleResource.Value: Enter your node URL in this field. For example, it could be http://www.dragoncorp.org/ or https://www.dragoncorp.org/mynode/ if you installed your node in a subdirectory.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.TaxManual.ByCountry.Text
LocaleResource.Value: The tax rates “By country/state/zip” option allows setting different tax rates based on a country, state, or zip.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.TaxManual.Categories.Text
LocaleResource.Value: This table contains tax categories used by offline tax providers. A few tax categories are created automatically during the installation process.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.TaxManual.Edit.Text
LocaleResource.Value: Click the Edit button to edit a tax rate for the specific tax category.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.TaxManual.Fixed.Text
LocaleResource.Value: The “Fixed tax rate” option allows you to set tax rates depending on the tax category.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.TaxManual.Switch.Text
LocaleResource.Value: The “Fixed rate/By country” switch allows you to choose the type of tax rates you’d like to use in your node.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.TaxProviders.Avalara.Text
LocaleResource.Value: You can automate the tax compliance in your node. Set up the Avalara tax provider, and you won’t need to worry about taxes anymore. Avalara is an automated tax compliance software. Read how to configure it in this article.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.TaxProviders.Configure.Text
LocaleResource.Value: Now we’ll configure the Manual tax provider. Click the Edit button to proceed to the module configuration page.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.TaxProviders.Manual.Text
LocaleResource.Value: Manual tax provider allows you to set up fixed tax rates depending on the country/state/zip.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.TaxProviders.PrimaryProvider.Text
LocaleResource.Value: You can mark the desired tax provider as a primary one using the Mark as primary provider button.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.TaxProviders.TaxProviders.Text
LocaleResource.Value: You can see all the tax providers (modules) allowed to use in your node on this page. However, you can always find much more in our marketplace.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.Topic.Preview.Text
LocaleResource.Value: To find out how your users will see the page, click the Preview button.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.Topic.TitleContent.Text
LocaleResource.Value: Enter a topic (page) title and its content in this field. This is what users will see in the public node.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.TopicList.Edit.Text
LocaleResource.Value: To edit this page, click the Edit button. You can also create a new topic by clicking the Add new button at the top of the page.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.TopicList.Location.Text
LocaleResource.Value: As you can see, this topic is included in the first column of the footer.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.TopicList.Topics1.Text
LocaleResource.Value: Topics (pages) are free-form content blocks that can be displayed on your site, either embedded within other pages or on their own pages. They are often used for FAQ pages, policy pages, special instructions, and more.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.TopicList.Topics2.Text
LocaleResource.Value: In this table, you can see a list of the topics created by default.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ConfigurationSteps.Welcome.Text
LocaleResource.Value: Can’t wait to start accepting orders? Let us show you how to set up your node fast and easy. The steps below describe the most important settings for the online shop. With our tips on each page you will see how clear this process is. You will be ready to start selling immediately after you go through these steps. So good luck!

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ContentManagement.MessageTemplates.Description.Blog.BlogComment
LocaleResource.Value: This message template is used when a new blog comment to the certain blog post is created. The message is received by an administrator. You can set up this option by ticking the checkbox Notify about new blog comments in Configuration - Settings - Blog settings.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ContentManagement.MessageTemplates.Description.User.EmailRevalidationMessage
LocaleResource.Value: This message template is used when a user changes an email address in his account. The user receives a message to confirm an email address used when changing email address.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ContentManagement.MessageTemplates.Description.User.EmailValidationMessage
LocaleResource.Value: This message template is used when Configuration - Settings - User settings - "Registration method" dropdownlist is set to "Email validation". The user receives a message to confirm an email address used when registering.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ContentManagement.MessageTemplates.Description.User.PasswordRecovery
LocaleResource.Value: This message template is used when a user forgets a password needed to log in the account. The user receives a message with a link for entering a new password.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ContentManagement.MessageTemplates.Description.User.WelcomeMessage
LocaleResource.Value: This message template is used to welcome a new user after registration.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ContentManagement.MessageTemplates.Description.NewUser.Notification
LocaleResource.Value: This message template is used when a new user is registered. The message is received by an administrator. You can set up this option by ticking the checkbox Notify about new user registration in Configuration - Settings - User settings.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ContentManagement.MessageTemplates.Description.News.NewsComment
LocaleResource.Value: This message template is used when a new comment to the certain news item is created. The message is received by an administrator. You can set up this option by ticking the checkbox Notify about new news comments in Configuration - Settings - News settings.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ContentManagement.MessageTemplates.Description.NewsLetterSubscription.ActivationMessage
LocaleResource.Value: This message template is used when a user subscribes to the newsletter to confirm the subscription.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ContentManagement.MessageTemplates.Description.NewsLetterSubscription.DeactivationMessage
LocaleResource.Value: This message template is used when a user unsubscribes to the newsletter to confirm the subscription deactivation. You can allow users to unsubscribe by ticking the checkbox Newsletter box. Allow to unsubscribe in Configuration - Settings - User settings.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ContentManagement.MessageTemplates.Description.NewVATSubmitted.Notification
LocaleResource.Value: This message template is used when a new VAT is submitted. The message is received by an administrator. You can set up this option by clicking Notify admin when a new VAT number is submitted in Configuration - Settings - Tax settings.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ContentManagement.MessageTemplates.Description.Service.ContactUs

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ContentManagement.MessageTemplates.Description.Service.ContactPartner

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ContentManagement.MessageTemplates.Description.Service.EmailAFriend

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ContentManagement.MessageTemplates.Description.PartnerAccountApply.Notification
LocaleResource.Value: This message template is used to notify an administrator that new user has applied for partner account. You can allow users to apply for partner account in Configuration - Setting - Partner settings by ticking the checkbox Allow users to apply for partner account.

LocaleResource.Name: Admin.ContentManagement.MessageTemplates.Description.PartnerInformationChange.Notification
